skill.name: Global Coding Style
skill.description: Write clean, consistent code following naming conventions, DRY principles, small focused functions, automated formatting, and meaningful variable names. Use this skill when writing or refactoring any code in any language, naming variables/functions/classes/files, structuring code logic, removing dead code, or ensuring code readability and maintainability. Apply to all programming tasks including Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Ruby, Java, Go, or any other language files (.py, .js, .ts, .rb, .java, .go) to maintain consistent style, improve code quality, and enhance team collaboration across the entire codebase.
skill.summary: Write clean, consistent code following naming conventions, DRY principles, small focused functions, ...
skill.author: EIS-ITS

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with coding guidelines. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution. Pure prompt-based skill for AI code generation guidance.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent code styles make collaboration difficult and increase maintenance costs. This skill provides AI with coding standards for writing clean, maintainable code following industry best practices.
actual_capabilities: Apply consistent naming conventions for variables, functions, and classes
Refactor code to follow DRY principles and eliminate duplication
Create small, focused functions with single responsibilities
Remove dead code, unused imports, and commented-out blocks
Format code with consistent indentation and structure
Write code optimized for readability and team collaboration
limitations: Does not execute or run code - provides guidelines only
Does not integrate with linters or formatters automatically
Does not modify files without explicit user request
Cannot enforce style rules across a codebase without user action

use_cases.title: Enforce Style Consistency

prompt_templates.title: Basic Code Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a function that processes user input with proper naming, small focused structure, and clear documentation

prompt_templates.title: Apply DRY Principle
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this code to follow DRY principles, extracting repeated logic into reusable functions

prompt_templates.title: Refactor for Readability
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this function to improve readability with better naming, smaller functions, and cleaner structure

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Language Standards
prompt_templates.prompt: Write Python and JavaScript implementations following global coding style conventions for both languages

output_examples.input: Write a function that calculates the total price with tax
output: Clean, well-named function with clear purpose
Single responsibility - only calculates price with tax
Proper documentation explaining parameters and return value

best_practices: Use descriptive names that reveal intent over abbreviations
Keep functions small with one primary responsibility
Remove dead code rather than commenting it out
Apply DRY principle to eliminate duplication
anti_patterns: Using single-letter variable names except for loop counters
Creating large functions that do multiple unrelated tasks
Leaving commented-out code in the codebase
Copy-pasting code instead of extracting shared logic

faq.question: Does this skill work with all programming languages?
faq.answer: Yes, the coding principles apply to Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Ruby, Java, Go, and most other languages.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my existing code files?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidelines but only modifies code when you explicitly request refactoring.

faq.question: Does it integrate with linters like ESLint or Black?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides AI guidance for code quality but does not run or configure external tools.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere when using this skill?
faq.answer: No, this is a prompt-based skill with no network access or data transmission.

faq.question: How is this different from a code formatter?
faq.answer: Formatters handle syntax and spacing. This skill guides AI to write cleaner logic, better names, and cleaner structure.

faq.question: Can I use this with other Claude skills?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill works alongside other coding skills to ensure consistent, high-quality code output.
